  • Constructor Details

    • HttpRequestHeader

      public HttpRequestHeader()
      Constructor for an empty header.

    • HttpRequestHeader

      public HttpRequestHeader(String data, boolean isSecure) throws HttpMalformedHeaderException
      Constructor of a request header with the string.
      Parameters:
      data - the request header
      isSecure - true if the request should be secure, false otherwise
      Throws:
      HttpMalformedHeaderException - if the request being set is malformed
      See Also:
      • setSecure(boolean)

    • HttpRequestHeader

      public HttpRequestHeader(String data) throws HttpMalformedHeaderException
      Constructor of a request header with the string. Whether this is a secure header depends on the URL given.
      Parameters:
      data - the request header
      Throws:
      HttpMalformedHeaderException - if the request being set is malformed

    • HttpRequestHeader

      public HttpRequestHeader(String method, org.apache.commons.httpclient.URI uri, String version) throws HttpMalformedHeaderException
      Constructs a HttpRequestHeader with the given method, URI, and version.

      The following headers are automatically added:

      • Host, with the domain and port from the given URI.
      • User-Agent, using the getDefaultUserAgent().
      • Pragma: no-cache
      • Cache-Control: no-cache, if version is HTTP/1.1
      • Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded, if the method is POST or PUT.
      Parameters:
      method - the request method.
      uri - the request target.
      version - the version, for example, HTTP/1.1.
      Throws:
      HttpMalformedHeaderException - if the resulting HTTP header is malformed.

    • HttpRequestHeader

      @Deprecated public HttpRequestHeader(String method, org.apache.commons.httpclient.URI uri, String version, ConnectionParam params) throws HttpMalformedHeaderException
      Deprecated.
      (2.8.0) Use HttpRequestHeader(String, URI, String) instead.
      Constructs a HttpRequestHeader with the given method, URI, and version.

      The following headers are automatically added:

      • Host, with the domain and port from the given URI.
      • User-Agent, using the getDefaultUserAgent().
      • Pragma: no-cache
      • Cache-Control: no-cache, if version is HTTP/1.1
      • Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded, if the method is POST or PUT.
      Parameters:
      method - the request method.
      uri - the request target.
      version - the version, for example, HTTP/1.1.
      params - unused.
      Throws:
      HttpMalformedHeaderException - if the resulting HTTP header is malformed.
      Since:
      2.4.2

    • getSecure

      @Deprecated public boolean getSecure()
      Deprecated.
      Replaced by isSecure(). It will be removed in a future release.
      Get if this request header is under secure connection.
      Returns:
      true if the request is secure, false otherwise

    • isSecure

      public boolean isSecure()
      Tells whether the request is secure, or not. A request is considered secure if it's using the HTTPS protocol.
      Returns:
      true if the request is secure, false otherwise.

    • setSecure

      public void setSecure(boolean isSecure) throws org.apache.commons.httpclient.URIException
      Sets whether or not the request is done using a secure scheme, HTTPS.
      Parameters:
      isSecure - true if the request should be secure, false otherwise
      Throws:
      org.apache.commons.httpclient.URIException - if an error occurred while rebuilding the request URI

    • getContentLength

      public int getContentLength()
      Get the content length in this request header. If the content length is undetermined, 0 will be returned.
      Overrides:
      getContentLength in class HttpHeader
      Returns:
      content length. -1 means content length not set.

    • getHostName

      public String getHostName()
      Get the host name in this request header.
      Returns:
      Host name.

    • getHostPort

      public int getHostPort()
      Gets the host port number of this request message, a non-negative integer.

      If no port is defined the default port for the used scheme will be returned, either 80 for HTTP or 443 for HTTPS.

      Returns:
      the host port number, a non-negative integer

    • isImage

      Returns:
      true if image.

    • getLocalAddress

      public InetSocketAddress getLocalAddress()

      This information is not persisted to the session.

      the local address.
      Since:

    • setDefaultUserAgent

      public static void setDefaultUserAgent(String defaultUserAgent)
      Sets the user agent used by default request header.
